title: Josh Sullivan Identity Font
author: A-type

comments.content:
It must be **[Vincent](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160958/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-8%20%2F%20%28Freemium%29&ffam=Vincent%20-%20Regular&fid=73e57b068ec7bdf562699e155bcc668f&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=JOSH%20SULIVAN&fit=1)** free font by Ben Suarez  
 [http://dribbble.com/shots/868554-Free-Typeface-VINCENT](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160958/http:/dribbble.com/shots/868554-Free-Typeface-VINCENT "http://dribbble.com/shots/868554-Free-Typeface-VINCENT")

United Sans Semi Condensed Bold by House Industries appears to be the closest foundry typeface, but I think this is actually Vincent, by Ben Suarez (the main difference between the two being the |J|):  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160958/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection")  
 [http://www.creativebloq.com/typography/font-day-vincent-7133653](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160958/http:/www.creativebloq.com/typography/font-day-vincent-7133653 "http://www.creativebloq.com/typography/font-day-vincent-7133653")
Solved, thank you guys. The United collection is also nice. House Industries is always solid.
